tern 0.5.0.1
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Summary Table by Visit

t_summarize_by_visit.Rd

This function summarizes test results or change from baseline statistics by visit. Corresponds to STREAM table templates EGT01, VST01 and LBT01.

t_summarize_by_visit(data, visit, id, col_by)

Arguments

data

data frame with numerical variables to be summarized. If the variable has a label attribute then it will be used as the sub-header column name.
visit

factor with visit names ordered by desired display order in the stacked table.
id

unique subject identifier variable.
col_by

factor with reference and comparison group information, the first level indicates the reference group

Value

an rtable object

Details

Every variable in data will be mapped to a sub-column under col_by column. Multiple variables will be shown side-by-side with the variable label (if present) or variable name as the sub-column header.

Currently n, Mean (SD), Median, IQR and Min-Max will be derived for each variable from data per each factor in col_by.

Examples


# EXAMPLE 1
ANL <- expand.grid(
  USUBJID = paste0("p-",1:100),
  VISIT = paste0("visit ", 1:10),
  ARM = c("ARM A", "ARM B")
)
ANL$AVAL <- rnorm(nrow(ANL))
ANL$CHG <- rnorm(nrow(ANL), 2, 2)
ANL$CHG[ANL$VISIT == "visit 1"] <- NA
ANL$PCHG <- ANL$CHG/ANL$AVAL*100

ANL$ARM <- factor(ANL$ARM)
ANL$VISIT <- factor(ANL$VISIT)

t_summarize_by_visit(data = ANL[c("AVAL")], visit = ANL$VISIT, col_by = ANL$ARM, id = ANL$USUBJID)
#>                       ARM A               ARM B    
#>                      (N=100)             (N=100)   
#> ---------------------------------------------------
#> visit 1
#>   n                    100                 100     
#>   Mean (SD)        0.07 (1.05)         -0.15 (1.06)
#>   Median               0.09               -0.17    
#>   IQR              -0.36 - 0.62        -0.71 - 0.57
#>   Min - Max        -2.61 - 2.76        -2.76 - 2.75
#> 
#> visit 2
#>   n                    100                 100     
#>   Mean (SD)        0.11 (1.01)         -0.21 (0.99)
#>   Median               0.13                -0.3    
#>   IQR              -0.61 - 0.86        -0.8 - 0.38 
#>   Min - Max        -1.9 - 2.56         -2.28 - 2.72
#> 
#> visit 3
#>   n                    100                 100     
#>   Mean (SD)        -0.03 (1.05)        -0.09 (0.99)
#>   Median               0.01               -0.02    
#>   IQR              -0.83 - 0.68        -0.8 - 0.54 
#>   Min - Max        -2.45 - 2.65        -1.95 - 3.11
#> 
#> visit 4
#>   n                    100                 100     
#>   Mean (SD)        0.19 (0.99)         0.08 (0.94) 
#>   Median               0.06                0.01    
#>   IQR               -0.42 - 1          -0.53 - 0.83
#>   Min - Max        -1.98 - 2.13        -1.7 - 2.59 
#> 
#> visit 5
#>   n                    100                 100

#>   Mean (SD)        -0.05 (0.97)        0.01 (0.94)

#>   Min - Max        -2.45 - 2.48        -2.37 - 2.21

# Add label to variable instead showing variable name
ANL <- var_relabel(ANL, AVAL = "Value at\nVisit",
                        CHG = "Change from\nBaseline",
                        PCHG = "Percent Change\nfrom Baseline")

t_summarize_by_visit(
  data = ANL[c("AVAL", "CHG")],
  visit = ANL$VISIT,
  col_by = ANL$ARM,
  id = ANL$USUBJID
)

# EXAMPLE 2
library(random.cdisc.data)
library(dplyr)

AQS <- radam("AQS") %>%
   filter(PARAMCD == "BFIALL") %>%
   mutate(
     ARM = factor(sample(c("ARM A", "ARM B", "ARM C"), nrow(.), replace = TRUE)),
     AVISIT = factor(AVISIT, levels = unique(AVISIT))
   )

tbl <- t_summarize_by_visit(
  data = AQS[c("AVAL", "CHG")],
  visit = AQS$AVISIT,
  col_by = AQS$ARM,
  id = AQS$USUBJID
)
tbl
#>                                 ARM A                                   ARM B                                   ARM C              
#>                                 (N=89)                                  (N=89)                                  (N=93)             
#>                        AVAL                CHG                 AVAL                CHG                 AVAL                CHG     
#> -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> WEEK 1
#>   n                     31                  31                  38                  38                  31                  31     
#>   Mean (SD)        -0.05 (0.9)            0 (0)            -0.22 (1.06)           0 (0)            0.09 (1.06)            0 (0)    
#>   Median              -0.28                 0                 -0.36                 0                 -0.01                 0      
#>   IQR              -0.58 - 0.25           0 - 0            -0.89 - 0.42           0 - 0            -0.45 - 0.54           0 - 0

# NOT RUN {
Viewer(tbl)
